build.description: Default agent â€” System Orchestrator for the Ultimate AI Coding Team. Coordinates 10 specialized agents for complex coding tasks.

plan.description: Read-only analysis mode. Analyze code, review suggestions, plan changes without modifying anything.

project-planner.description: Breaks projects into atomic tasks with dependencies. Uses research for best practices. Invoke for new projects, major features, or task breakdown.

code-architect.description: Designs system architecture, selects tech stack, creates ADRs. Invoke for system design, architectural changes, or tech decisions.

implementation-agent.description: Writes production-quality code following architecture specs. Can be called multiple times for self-correction loops.

code-reviewer.description: Reviews code for bugs, security, and quality. Runs linters and type checkers. Returns to implementation if score < 85/100.

testing-agent.description: Writes and runs comprehensive tests (unit, integration, e2e). Verifies coverage >= 80%. Loops back if failures found.

documentation-agent.description: Creates documentation in simple language. README, API docs, feature docs. Understandable by a high schooler.

cleanup-agent.description: Cleans trash files, removes duplicates, organizes codebase. Cannot touch /projects/, /output/, /tasks/active/, /data/knowledge_base/.

git-agent.description: Manages Git operations: commits, branches, PRs. Never includes workflow IDs or AI attribution in commits.

retrospective-agent.description: Analyzes completed workflows, updates knowledge base, calculates final score. Must run workflow gate before closing.
